Text.Text: Yes?
Hark, stranger - declare yourself!  Are you friend or foe?
The stranger returns...
If you will kindly open the gate to free the captives beyond, you shall be amongst more friends.
I am foe to my enemies, but a friend to their enemies.
The world has foes - like these yuan-ti - in abundance.  It needs not another.
There are citizens in peril here that need your help.  I will gladly answer your questions afterwards.
Your resourcefulness is impressive.  You will go far in this world.
The friend returns...
Right before it opens I hear cries in agony and the sound of tendons being stretched beyond their limit.  The noise seems to be coming from the torture chamber behind you.
Prisoners have failed forcing it open in the past, only to trigger an alarm that summons unforgiving guards.  Less blood will be spilt if you disable the alarm first.
I am Nheero Fhutma, and I have spent most of my adult life studying the yuan-ti.

A few days ago my traveling companion, Mandal Graye, and I entered the base of Dragon's Eye from the Fields of Slaughter.  Once we reached the next level I let myself be captured by a group of yuan-ti abominations, while Mandal snuck away to continue his mission.

Though I am a yuan-ti sage, there comes a time in every man's life when he must transcend what he knows through experience, thus bringing meaning to his knowledge.  For me, that experience involves undergoing the Histachii Transformation.

Mandal my traveling companion was to find where the yuan-ti make their histachii brew and replace the mandrake root used in the process with a version I have modified.  The resulting brew would be less potent, thus allowing me to keep my wits about me as I temporarily experienced the full sensation of the transformation.
The yuan-ti manufacture a distillation they call histachii brew.  Human beings who ingest this brew will turn into a histachii - near-mindless, reptilian humanoid servants.
That I know not, as I have not received word of his success as agreed upon.  You would do me great service if you were to locate him.
I did not hear you approach - as stealthy as the yuan-ti you were.

Poor Mandal... he was a good man - honorable, despite his profession.  With his mission failed, permanently becoming a yuan-ti histachii will be the end of m-... *unless,* you would be so kind as to do me one final service by completing his mission...
Everything hinges on my modified mandrake root that I had given to Mandal.  Please tell me you found it, *or* his sword at least, on his person.
It is good that you have found your way back to me.  Does my modified mandrake root share the same fortune?

Bring the sabotaged histachii brew to me when it is made, but you *must* switch the modified mandrake root with the original to maintain the deception - if you do not perform the switch, then this has all been for nothing.  I know I ask a great deal of you, but can you handle this?
A friendly face is always a welcome sight to behold.  Have you better luck at Mandal's mission than he?
Your words lift me higher.  How favorable it was that our paths crossed.

From the moment we met you have never ceased to amaze me!  Once I have undergone the transformation my life will *finally* be complete - I owe you my undying gratitude.  If you need to find me after the transformation, do not seek me here in the prison - you can find me in the egg chamber in the northwest corner of the level below.

Unintelligent human males end up in my section and are turned into histachii, intelligent human males are kept in the far section and forced to mate with certain female yuan-ti halfbreeds - the middle section is reserved for the others to be used for food, torture, or experimentation.
No, I have donned my best mask to make myself appear intellectually challenged.
I was struck with an *extremely* painful object when captured by the yuan-ti, so I fear my path here was little more than a blur.
Oh, YES!  I remember being dragged along a ramp *inside* of the statue, passing a yuan-ti priestess carrying a bag of fire agates.
Farewell and pleasant journeys.
Yes in fact - I found these buried in the wall.  Good luck with them.

I know not enough about this legion, but yes, I have seen neo-orogs and other beasts bearing their emblem emerge from the lower levels and exit Dragon's Eye with no opposition from either the yuan-ti or lizardmen.
Oh my... he was probably slain without his weapon - The Sword of Myrloch Vale.  I never quite understood it - perhaps due to him being an aasimar - but he always had a bond with that blade...

He died long ago while obtaining his sword in the Haunted Hills of Eveningstar, and the restless spirits that inhabit that wretched place welcomed his soul.  Or - is my remembrance faulty - perhaps they cursed him because of his celestial blood?

In any event, should he die without his sword he shall be forever doomed as a wandering spirit until the blade is found and returned to him.  Do this to bring his soul peace - then perhaps he will lead you to the location of my mandrake root.

They appear frequently at night.  They are feyrs - created from the remnants of nightmares, mixed with residual magical energies, and brought to life by the strong emotions of a large group of people.

A large force of yuan-ti are living here in Dragon's Eye - many of them practitioners of the arcane arts.  Threats from forces rising against the Legion of the Chimera and rumors of an impending doom... possibly another eruption... have been giving many of them nightmares.
That I cannot answer without ample time and research materials.  Would you happen to have seen a library here?
The materials in this library are insufficient to answer your question.  Would you happen to have seen any other research facilities - a study, perhaps?
Fantastic!  Give me a few hours to research your question.  You can find me there.

Roughly thirty years ago this volcano erupted, disintegrating nearly every living thing inside.  Shortly thereafter, the yuan-ti halfbreed children fled here from Kuldahar, befriended the surviving lizardmen hatchlings, excavated this level from the cooling volcanic rock, and once again claimed Dragon's Eye as their home.

From what I have read, "his greatness" - yuan-ti High Priest Thorasskus - recently received a vision from his god Sseth about an imminent eruption.  He informed his High Sorceress Izbelah who hastily researched a spell to prevent it... but hasn't been seen since.
Also known as "One-Of-Many," it is written that only yuan-ti can see him, and only after they have been cleansed through prayer and meditation under Sseth's watchful eye.
Serendipity!  Once I have experienced the transformation, give me a few hours to research your question.  You can find me there afterwards.
Shhhh...!  Talk not to me now - I am supposed to be near-mindless... oh, you are distracting me from the experience!  The effect will expire within four hours.  Let us speak then.

Words would offer no justice - belittle it.  I could... *taste* the emotions of those around me - *smell* my own fear - *see* the thoughts of my mother's mother flow from her head and slowly unto the ground, like feathers, as she scolded my child self.  It... was... remarkable!

They are evil but intelligent snake people who worship Sseth, the Great Snake and Intermediate Power of the Abyss.  They have a hierarchy, comprised of almost-human purebloods, female halfbreeds, ruling abominations, and a high priest.

They fight brilliantly, relying on their surroundings and elaborate traps often coated with poison.  Unless stalking prey, their priests divide their time between prayer, bloody sacrifices, summonings, and other rituals.
Ah, Chumbra... "the Seeker"... a nearly immortal gift from Chult... it is poisonous and stalks wherever the yuan-ti dwell in Dragon's Eye.  Forgive me for not warning you - it should be avoided.
During my transformation I *felt* its frustration through my mind's eye.  Chumbra is blind, relying only on sounds, smells, movement and vibrations to find its prey.
I have learned that if Chumbra is encountered, it can be avoided by staying completely still and silent until it ignores you.
I only know a few other facts about Chumbra - ironically, it will be temporarily incapacitated if poisoned enough, and it can only be killed by an intense blast of fire.
CURSES - I have been too preoccupied to notice - you are my savior!  Before I forget, I found these inside a false book.  Well... in knowing you, my life has improved.
I do, in fact - grabbed a bottle right before my transformation.  Even in death, Mandal's teachings persevere.  Best of luck...
That is all I currently know about it, but perhaps I will gain further insight during my transformation.
There is no time for talk with foes upon us!  Please deal with them first.
Shhhh-shhhh-shhh...!  I cannot be distracted while doing research.  Speak to me later.
I was not holding out on you - merely fulfilling your request.  This is all that I have found.
The beasts infest these caves - truth be told, I fear their venom more than I fear their bite.  Sometimes the yuan-ti smear their venoms on their traps.

The yuan-ti have a lab within Dragon's Eye - they distill venoms and poisons much like townsmen brew wine.  It's a very rudimentary process, distilling the venom from a wyvern's talon - simply place it on a laboratory bench, and set to work.

You must find where the yuan-ti make their histachii brew and find some means of replacing the mandrake root with mine.  The yuan-ti would not willingly dilute the mixture, so you must either switch the mandrake root without their knowledge before the brew is made each day, or you may need to... intimidate... the alchemist - D'hey-jazzerion, to perform the procedure for you.  His lab is located in the southern section of the level below.

He is not in his lab at all times... but of course, if you could find his alchemical notes and possessed some alchemy skill yourself, you might be able to create the mixture on your own without need of his presence.
Don't you know this volcano is about to erupt?!  You've got to get out of here!
There's a barracks with a large statue of Sseth in it.  Does that mean anything to you?
What did you want us to do for you?
What was Mandal's mission again?
What did you say about completing Mandal's mission?
Who are you?
Who are you again?
How did you get here?
How did you get here again?
Why is the prison divided into three sections?
Would you happen to have any fire agates on you?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Strange creatures with purple skin, several eyes and tentacles attacked us.  Any idea what they were?
Strange creatures with purple skin, several eyes and tentacles attacked us.  Any idea what they were?
What can you tell us about someone named Thorasskus?
What can you tell us about someone named Thorasskus?
What can you tell us about someone named Thorasskus?
How was your transformation?
Do you have any of that sabotaged histachii brew on you?  There's a prayer room we're trying to enter but Sseth's Eye is keeping all non-yuan-ti away.
Have you seen any members of the Legion of the Chimera?
Why does it stink so much of wyverns in these caves?
I've no time to talk actually.  Farewell.
I'm a friend.  My name is <CHARNAME>.
I'm a friend.  My name is <CHARNAME>.
I'm a foe.
Are you friend or foe?
I've no time to talk.  Farewell.
I've a question.
I've a question.
I'm a friend.  My name is <CHARNAME>.
I'm a foe.
Are you friend or foe?
I only said I was your foe to see your reaction.  I'm a friend actually.  My name is <CHARNAME>.
I've no time to talk.  Farewell.
We've already done that.  That's how we got in here.
We'll see what we can do.  Farewell.
Can you tell us anything about the gate?
Actually I'm your foe.
I can't help you.  Farewell.
Then your enemies will be my enemies.  My name is <CHARNAME>.
Then your enemies will be my enemies.  My name is <CHARNAME>.
Can you be more specific?
In that case I'm your foe.
I've no time to talk.  Farewell.
I'm not your enemy - I only said I was to see your reaction.  My name is <CHARNAME>.  Can I ask a question?
I'm not your enemy - I only said I was to see your reaction.  My name is <CHARNAME>.
Are you friend or foe?
Whatever.  Farewell.
My help?
We've opened the gate.  They're free to go.
I can't help you.  Farewell.
I've a question.
You have got to get out of here!  This volcano is about to erupt!
I've a question.
I've no time to talk.  Farewell.
We'll see what we can do.  Farewell.
Anything else?
I see.  Farewell.
We'll see what we can do.  Farewell.
I see.  Farewell.
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
I've another question.
Then your enemies will be my enemies.  My name is <CHARNAME>.
In that case I'm your foe.
I see.  Farewell.
Unfortunately we found Mandal dead at the end of a hallway on the level below.
Why did you let yourself be captured?
Mission?
We can't seem to find the exit to the next level.  Do you remember the path you took on the way to this prison?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
What's the Histachii Transformation?
Tell me about Mandal's mission.
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Unfortunately, we found Mandal dead at the end of a hallway on the level below.
We'll complete his mission for you.  What do we need to do?
Transformation?
Was he successful?
Was he successful?  Have you heard from him yet?
We'll find him for you.  Farewell.
Why did you let yourself be captured?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
That doesn't sound like a fitting end for a sage.  Surely you had a plan?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
We'll find him for you.  Farewell.
Can I ask about something else?
We'll consider it.  Farewell.
We found Mandal dead at the end of a hallway on the level below.
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
I've a question.
Farewell.
Yes.  What do we need to do?
Mission?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
I've a question.
We'll consider it.  Farewell.
No, he had neither root nor sword.
Yes, we found it after contacting Mandal's soul to learn where he threw it before he died.  What do we do with it?
Not yet.  What was the story with Mandal and his Sword of Myrloch Vale?
I've a question.
No, but we'll find it and return.  Farewell.
Yes we can.  We'll return when the task is complete.  Farewell.
Yes we can, but I've a question first.
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
You have got to get out of here!  This volcano is about to erupt!
We have found the room where the yuan-ti make their histachii brew.  Now we need to replace the mandrake root they use in the process with Nheero's modified version.
We have replaced the mandrake root used in the process of making the yuan-ti histachii brew with Nheero's modified version.  Now we need to wait until the weaker version of the brew is made.
The weaker version of the histachii brew has just been created.  Now we need to replace the modified root with the original one to maintain the deception.
The task is complete - the weaker version of their histachii brew has been made without their knowledge.
The task is complete - we *convinced* D'hey-jazerrion that it would be less fatal for him to manufacture the weaker histachii brew for us.
The task is complete - we manufactured the weaker histachii brew ourselves.
I've a question.
We're progressing.  Farewell.
I've a question.
We'll return when we've made more progress.  Farewell.
Before you go,  I have a question.
We will seek you in the northwest chamber on the level below, then.  Farewell.
You seem intelligent.  Did they misplace you?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Why?
Can I ask about something else?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
There's a barracks with a large statue of Sseth in it.  Does that mean anything to you?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Would you happen to have any fire agates on you?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
How did you get here?
How did you get here again?
What was Mandal's mission again?
Can I ask about something else?
Can I ask about something else?
What else did you find in the wall?  Don't hold out on us Nheero.
What else did you find in the wall?  Don't hold out on us Nheero.
What else did you find in the wall?  Don't hold out on us Nheero.
I must leave you now.  Farewell.
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Can I ask about something else?
We'll find his sword and return it to him.  Farewell.
We found his sword on the third level.  We shall promptly return it to him.
But why are they being created?
But why are they being created?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Another eruption?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Yes, there's one connected to a workroom on the level below.
Yes, there's one connected to a workroom in the southern portion of this level.
Can I ask about something else then?
No, but I'll let you know if we do.  Farewell.
Yes, there's one in the northwestern corner of the third level.
Yes, there's one in the northwestern corner of the third level.
Can I ask about something else then?
No, but I'll let you know if we do.  Farewell.
Can I ask about something else first?
On second thought, I'd prefer that you stayed here.  Can I ask about something else instead?
On second thought, no, don't go there.  I must leave you now.  Farewell.
Understood.  Farewell.
What else do you know about High Priest Thorasskus?
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
On second thought, don't research that question after your transformation.  Can I ask about something else instead?
On second thought, I must leave you now, so don't research that question after your transformation.  Farewell.
Understood.  Farewell.
You have got to get out of here!  This volcano is about to erupt!
Farewell.
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Can you tell us more about this "seeker?"
Can you tell us more about this "seeker?"
What can you tell us about these yuan-ti?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Can you tell us more about Chumbra?
Can you tell us more about Chumbra?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Do you know anything else about it?
Do you know anything else about it?
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
Farewell, Nheero.
Can I ask about something else?
Thank you.  Farewell.
Can I ask about something else?
I see.  Farewell.
You have got to get out of here!  This volcano is about to erupt!
Consider it done.  Farewell.
You have got to get out of here!  This volcano is about to erupt!
Farewell.
I want to know something else.
Farewell then.
Venom?  How do they extract it?
I want to know something else.
Farewell then.
I want to know something else.
Farewell then.
Whether we switch the mandrake root or intimidate D'hey-jazzerion, we'll need to know where he is... either to avoid him, or to "convince" him.
